message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for sale. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150. This is a great deal, considering its value and uniqueness.
I'm really interested in the product, but $150 is a bit out of my budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $120?
I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $135. This is a fair compromise considering its value and uniqueness. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $135 is still a bit too high for me. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $110?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. I'm willing to make another compromise. I can offer you the product for $125. This is as low as I can go while still making it worth my while. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, but $125 is still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $115?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I can offer you the product for $122. This is as low as I'm willing to go. If you're still interested, I'd be willing to meet at this price. Otherwise, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your willingness to meet you at $122, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $115?
